    • Method Detail

      • leftShift

        public static int leftShift(byte value,
                            int shift)
        Left shifts a byte. When the byte first bit is 1, the cast to integer, that happens before the shift, turns every bit before that to 1. The same of do: byte | 0xFFFFFF00. Use only if the behaviour above is not expected.
        Parameters:
        value - the byte to shift.
        shift - the amount to shift.
        Returns:
        the shifted byte as integer.

      • addressToInstruction

        public static int addressToInstruction(java.lang.String address)
                                throws InvalidAddressRepresentationException
        Parses a string address in hexa to its binary representation. Address limits: 0x0 to 0xFFFF and can be prefixed with any length of 0's.
        Parameters:
        address - the address.
        Returns:
        the binary representation.
        Throws:
        InvalidAddressRepresentationException - if the address does not follow its limits.
